comments:
Install I20040218

Clean workspace, no plugins in workspace.

Run eclipse from eclipse.

Get the following in the console:

Unknown argument: -dev bin -console -os macosx -ws carbon -arch ppc -nl en_US
Buildfile: /Users/ssq/Desktop/eclipse/build.xml

BUILD FAILED
Buildfile: /Users/ssq/Desktop/eclipse/build.xml does not exist

Total time: 0 seconds

Go to Window -> Preferences -> Plugin Development -> Target Platform.
Only 55 plugins are listed - missing are org.eclipse.ui.ide and a bunch of othe rorg,eclipse.ui ones.  

Get the following in the .log:

!SESSION Feb 18, 2004 15:07:24.622 ---------------------------------------------
java.version=1.4.1_01
java.vendor=Apple Computer, Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=macosx, ARCH=ppc, WS=carbon, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments: -data /Users/ssq/Desktop/eclipse/runtime-workspace -dev bin
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi Feb 18, 2004 15:07:24.623
!MESSAGE Bundle reference:file:/Users/ssq/Desktop/eclipse/workspace/org.eclipse.core.xray [15] 
was not resolved
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.osgi Feb 18, 2004 15:07:24.627
!MESSAGE Missing required bundle org.eclipse.ui
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.osgi Feb 18, 2004 15:07:24.628
!MESSAGE Missing optionally required bundle org.eclipse.ui.ide
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.osgi Feb 18, 2004 15:07:24.628
!MESSAGE Missing optionally required bundle org.eclipse.ui.views
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.osgi Feb 18, 2004 15:07:24.629
!MESSAGE Missing optionally required bundle org.eclipse.ui.editors
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.osgi Feb 18, 2004 15:07:24.630
!MESSAGE Missing optionally required bundle org.eclipse.ui.workbench.texteditor
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi Feb 18, 2004 15:07:24.652
!MESSAGE Bundle reference:file:/Users/ssq/Desktop/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.ui.carbon_3.0.0 
[53] was not resolved
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.osgi Feb 18, 2004 15:07:24.654
!MESSAGE Missing host org.eclipse.ui_3.0.0
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.osgi Feb 18, 2004 15:07:24.655
!MESSAGE Missing required bundle org.eclipse.ui
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 13 Feb 18, 2004 15:07:24.660
!MESSAGE Unable to locate application extension: org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench
!STACK 0
java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to locate application extension: org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run(PlatformActivator.java:236)
        at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:106)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:279)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:742)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:581)

It's definitely a problem with Core at startup.  I couldn't even start with 
that build with the same problem.  Could not find the 
org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench application.

Moving to Core.

org.eclipse.ui seems to be the culprit that started the whole chain reaction 
of plug-in disablement.
cc Nick for comment.

What is really strange and why I told Silenio to enter a bug against you, is 
that it is the same eclipse install that is targeted for self-hosting than the 
one we are running against.
So if UI had problems, would not have been able to start.

That is strange.  However, PDE calls Core to resolve the plug-ins at the 
specified location.  So the Core resolver must have had a reason to disable or 
drop org.eclipse.ui.

I notice that the first part of the console text talks about a failing build.  
This is because of the extra command line args.  We are working on a way of 
striping them so that AntRunner does not even see them but are not there yet.  

Question, why is an ant build running when you start up an eclipse on an empty 
workspace?

It is because the application beingrun is actually AntRunner (it is the first one in the list of available 
applications).

BTW, the log shows that the resolution fails because there is a cycle between 
core.runtime.compatibility and org.eclipse.ui (???). This resolution failure triggers many other 
failures, causing many plugins to be missing:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.pde.core 2 1 Feb 19, 2004 09:50:39.353
!MESSAGE Problems while scanning external plug-ins
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.runtime 2 1 Feb 19, 2004 09:50:39.359
!MESSAGE Detected prerequisite loop from "org.eclipse.ui" to 
"org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility".

The question is: how did org.eclipse.ui end up as a pre-requisite for 
org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility? And why only on Mac?

If an older target platform (such as M7) is selected in the PDE preference page,
it works just fine. Must be something in the layout of recent builds that
triggers this behavior in the (old) resolver.

Could it be the removal of the Bundle Manifest files for runtime and 
runtime.compatibility that caused the problem?

It still happens with today's i-build (which has the manifests). The error
happens in the old resolver, which does not know about bundle manifests, and so
far I believe it is not related. 

I am able to reproduce it on Windows selecting the Mac OSX install as target
platform.

Found the problem: the platform specific fragment for org.eclipse.ui adds a
requirement to org.eclipse.ui, thus making org.eclipse.ui to require itself (!).

Changing the fragment manifest to not add any pre-requisites (shouldn't have to
require anything).

I agree, the message does not help much (the loop is not between compatibility
and ui, but with UI itself). Will keep this open to handle the message issue.

Opened a new issue against Platform/UI: bug 52495.
This is an issue with othe old resolver. Moving to the right component.
Wassim, is it true that PDE does not use PluginRegistryModel#resolve anymore?

RC, what you heard is true.
We use the State for both 2.1 and 3.0 targets.

Ok, that deems this bug invalid (the old plugin registry resolver is not used in
our infrastructure anymore).

traces.message: Unable to locate application extension: org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench
